item.title: Using the Parquet format with OBIS data
item.description: What is Parquet? Parquet is a lightweight format designed for columnar storage. Its main difference when compared to other formats like csv is that Parquet is column-oriented (while csv is row-oriented). This means that Parquet is much more efficient for data accessing.To illustrate, consider the scenario of extracting data from a specific column in a CSV file. This operation entails reading through all rows across all columns. In contrast, Parquet enables selective access solely to the required column, minimizing unnecessary data retrieval.
